title: Alyssa Milano shows off her gorgeous gams in a colorful mini dress
text:
She's been busily spruiking her first children's book, Hope: Project Middle School.

And Alyssa Milano made another stop on her promotional tour on Wednesday, popping into ABC studios in new York City, with a copy of the tome she co-authored Debbie Rigaud clutched in her hand.

The 46-year-old Charmed star turned heads in a colorful mini dress for the outing.

Hustlin': Alyssa Milano made another stop on her promotional tour on Wednesday, popping into ABC studios in new York City

The breakout star of 80s sitcom Who's The Boss? showed off plenty of her shapely pins in the dress, which boasted a high hemline.

Milano's slightly coiffed brunette tresses were pulled back from her fine features, and the standout of her impeccable makeup was a dab of smokey eye.

On her feet, Alyssa wore a simple pair of black pumps.

The look: The 46-year-old Charmed star turned heads in a colorful mini dress for the outing

The eyes have it: Milano's slightly coiffed brunette tresses were pulled back from her fine features, and the standout of her impeccable makeup was a dab of smokey eye

It's been two years since Milano tweeted the #MeToo hashtag that started a global movement among women - and men - who had been sexually abused.

And it's that movement Milano aims to continue to grow with her book.

Hope: Project Middle School is about 11-year-old Hope Roberts who 'dreams big' and 'believes it's always a good day to champion a cause, defend an underdog, and save the future,' according to Google Books.

That certainly describes the actress's life.

Alyssa has frequently said she had no idea the tweet she sent out on October 15, 2017, would go viral.

Legs for daze: The breakout star of 80s sitcom Who's The Boss? showed off plenty of her shapely pins in the dress, which boasted a high hemline

It was seen 19 million times in the first year.

It lead to the downfall of filmmaker Harvey Weinstein, among others, who is facing sexual abuse allegations in court.

Alyssa was, in fact, continuing the work of civil rights activist Tarana Burke, 46, who founded the MeToo movement in 2006.
